# Neuronavigation data

The neuronavigation data was analysed using following code

```{r code neuronavigation}
#| echo: fenced
#| eval: true # code is executed

library(readxl)
data <- read_excel("/Users/linafricke/Documents/Promotion/Studie 1/06_Data/Neuronavigation/Neuronavigation_einschluss.xlsx")
View(data)

library(dplyr)

# Euklidische Distanz pro Proband berechnen
df_dist <- data %>%
  group_by(vp, marker) %>%
  summarise(
    dist = sqrt((x[2] - x[1])^2 + (y[2] - y[1])^2 + (z[2] - z[1])^2),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

# Ergebnis anzeigen
print(df_dist)

# Gemittelte Distanz über alle Proband*innen pro Marker
df_mean <- df_dist %>%
  group_by(marker) %>%
  summarise(mean_dist = mean(dist))

# Ergebnis anzeigen
print(df_mean)
df_mean
```

## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
